Google Scholar

[PDF] Student perceptions of web design: Implications for educators

JD Smith, MK Johnson - Computers & Education, 2010 - Elsevier
This study examines student perceptions of web design principles and their application in educational contexts. Results indicate that students value both aesthetic and functional aspects of web interfaces.
Cited by 152 Related articles Cite
[PDF] example.com

Web programming for student learning: A comprehensive approach

AL Brown, CD Davis, EF Wilson - International Journal of Educational Technology, 2011 - Springer
A framework for teaching web programming to students, emphasizing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals. The study presents learning outcomes from a semester-long course.
Cited by 89 Related articles Cite

[PDF] Student engagement in web development: HTML5 and beyond

GH Lee, IJ Kim, KL Park - ACM Transactions on Computing Education, 2015 - dl.acm.org
This research investigates student engagement levels when learning modern web development technologies including HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design frameworks.
Cited by 234 Related articles Cite
[PDF] arxiv.org

Teaching web design to students: Best practices and challenges

MN Martinez, OP Nguyen - Teaching Web Technologies, 2012 - Springer
A comprehensive review of pedagogical approaches for teaching web design to undergraduate students, including practical exercises and assessment strategies.
Cited by 67 Related articles Cite

[HTML] Student-centered web programming: A project-based approach

QR Rodriguez, ST Thompson - Proceedings of IEEE Frontiers in Education Conference, 2013 - IEEE
This paper presents a project-based learning approach for teaching web programming to computer science students, with emphasis on HTML, JavaScript, and server-side technologies.
Cited by 143 Related articles Cite
